business.headline: Trump targets Samsung after tax threat to Apple for India shift: Wouldn't be fairThe US President warned that Samsung, and not only Apple, would face a 25% import tax if its phones were not manufactured in America.
Trump proposes 50% tariff on EU goods from June 1Trump criticised the EU for maintaining restrictive trade practices, levying high taxes, and taking legal action against US companies.

RBI to pay Rs 2.69 lakh crore to government as dividend for FY25The RBI has approved a large dividend of Rs 2.69 lakh crore for the financial year 2025, which is higher than Rs 2.1 lakh crore given last year.

Not India or anyplace else: Trump's 25% tariff warning if iPhones not made in USDonald Trump's statement on levying 25% tariff on iPhones has caused Apple shares to fall by 2.5% in premarket trading, and US stock futures also slipped. However, it's still unclear whether Trump actually has the legal power to impose a tariff on one specific company.

Fresh IPOs likely to flood Dalal Street: Time to ride the wave?Four IPOs are lined up to open in the last week of May. These include Scoda Tubes, Prostarm Info Systems, Leela Hotels (Schloss Bangalore Limited), and Aegis Vopak Terminals.

Rs 10 crore for child's education? Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta's maths and messageRadhika Gupta explained that the current cost of a full higher education in the US is around Rs 2.5 crore. Now, if you consider average inflation of 5% and currency depreciation of 4% every year, the value of that education will go up a lot over the next 16 years.

Sensex, Nifty close higher over US-China trade hopes despite FII outflow fearsThe S&P BSE Sensex added 769.09 points to close at 81,721.08, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 243.45 points to end at 24,853.15.

Microsoft, Google and more cut over 61,000 jobs in 2025: Here's why?One of the biggest cuts came from Microsoft, which let go of 6,000 employees, its largest round of job losses since 2023. Nearly 2,000 of these were in Washington state alone.

Reliance Power Ltd share price rises over 18%. Should you buy?Reliance Power has gained 20.77% in the last month, 51.98% over the last six months, and 99.13% over the past year. Over the last five years, it has gone up by a massive 2,820.56%.

India plans to let US, other foreign firms bid for government contracts: ReportContracts worth over $50 billion, primarily issued by federal agencies, could soon be accessible to US companies as part of a broader effort to strike a limited trade agreement with Washington by early July.

Bajaj Auto to take over KTM with massive €800 million dealThe move is aimed at helping KTM recover from financial trouble and marks a major step forward for Bajaj, which has been a minority investor in KTM since 2007.

'Data can be misleading': Nithin Kamath on rise of Tier 2 and 3 city investorsZerodha's Nithin Kamath explained that if you look at the addresses provided by users during their KYC process, it appears many traders are from Tier 2 and Tier 3 towns. However, this can be misleading because most people don't update their address when they move to a new city.

ITC share price rises 3% today. Check brokerage views and what should investors do?The stock was trading 2.78% higher at Rs 437.95, recovering from Thursday's close of Rs 426.10, as investors appeared to focus on the company's long-term fundamentals rather than short-term headwinds.

Some individuals don't need to file an ITR. Are you one of them?As the 2025–26 financial year begins, the Income Tax Department has released all the seven ITR forms along with the ITR-U form.  But did you know not everyone is required to file a return?

Adani Group to invest Rs 50,000 crore in Northeast over next decadeThe fresh investment commitment comes just months after the Adani Group pledged Rs 50,000 crore in Assam alone, targeting sectors like airports, aero cities, city gas distribution, transmission, cement, and road infrastructure.

Explained: Why IMF gave Pakistan $1 billion despite India's objectionsThe IMF agreed to support Pakistan with a total of $7 billion under the EFF programme. So far, it has given $2.1 billion in two separate instalments.

Have BSE shares really crashed? Here's why some apps show a 66% fallThe apparent crash was just a technical adjustment following the company's 2:1 bonus issue, which turned the stock ex-bonus today. Some trading platforms may not have accounted for this corporate action in their price charts, leading to misleading visuals of a steep 65% drop. In reality, the share price simply adjusted to reflect the bonus allotment.

Sensex jumps 900 points: Why stock market is rising today and what next?Market watchers suggest the current bounce is likely driven by a 'buy-on-dips' strategy that many investors have adopted amid recent volatility. Despite concerns about the global macro environment, the strength in domestic fundamentals seems to be offering support.

Honasa shares rise 13% despite decline in Q4 net profitThe company's revenue from operations went up by 13% year-on-year (YoY), reaching Rs 534 crore in Q4FY25. However, despite the rise in revenue, Honasa's consolidated net profit fell by 18% YoY.
Sensex, Nifty move up in early session despite concerns over FII flowsThe S&P BSE Sensex went up by 289.27 points to 81,241.26, while the NSE Nifty50 added 119.15 points to 24,728.85 as of 9:29 am.

Borana Weaves IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusBorana Weaves IPO opened for subscription on May 20 and closed on May 22. The IPO saw strong demand from all investor groups. It was subscribed 147.85 times in total.

GST rates may change soon as fresh revamp talks begin: ReportGST, which was launched in July 2017, brought together many indirect taxes into one system and created a single national market. The latest round of talks follows the government's introduction of a bill in February this year to simplify income tax laws.

Sensex, Nifty opening: Stock market likely to open higher today. Here's whyStock market opening: The Nifty50 index may open slightly above its previous close. Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,692.5 at 7:59 am, showing a possible rise from Thursday's close of 24,609.7.

Stocks to watch on May 23: ITC, Ola, Honasa, Sun Pharma, JSW SteelA number of companies will release their January-March quarter results today. These include JSW Steel, Ashok Leyland, Glenmark Pharmaceuticals, Afcons Infrastructure, etc.

Sensex closes 645 points lower, Nifty below 24,700; IndusInd Bank gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 644.64 points to end at 80,951.99, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 203.75 points to close at 24,609.70.

Borana Weaves IPO booked over 100 times: Check latest subscription, GMPAllotment for the Borana Weaves IPO is expected to be finalised on Friday, May 23, 2025. The company is likely to list its shares on the stock exchanges on Tuesday, May 27, 2025.
Reliance to start solar module factory this year: ReportThis year, Reliance Industries will launch its solar module factory, aiming to meet India's clean energy goals by producing 20 GW annually.

World's happiest and unhappiest careers revealed. Is your job among them?Researchers at the University of Tartu in Estonia looked at 263 different jobs and asked over 59,000 people about their work and life satisfaction. They also used health data from the Estonian Biobank to get a better picture of what really makes people happy in their jobs.

Covid cases surge in India: Will it trigger a stock market crash?Stock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex had dropped by over 900 points to 80,681.76, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 266 points at 24,547.45 as of 12:45 pm. The fall in the market comes after days of strong performance.

Walmart to cut 1,500 jobs in restructuring move: ReportThe job cuts will affect several areas, including Walmart's global tech team, the e-commerce section in US stores, and its advertising arm, Walmart Connect.

EPFO adds 14.58 lakh members in March. Women and youth lead the wayMost of the new members who joined EPFO for the first time in March were youngsters. Around 4.45 lakh people in the 18–25 age group signed up in March, making up nearly 59% of all new subscribers. Many in this age group are first-time jobseekers.

Tata Teleservices shares jumps 11% today. What's driving the rally?The trigger behind the rally appears to be growing speculation around a potential capital infusion by Tata Sons Ltd into its struggling telecom subsidiary, Tata Teleservices Ltd (TTSL).

ABFRL demerger: Brokerages assign fair value to new fashion twins. Details hereBrokerages have begun breaking down the newly split entities, laying out distinct growth paths and fair value estimates for both ABFRL and ABLBL.

All ITR forms are out, but you still can't file. What's causing the delay?While all seven ITR forms (ITR-1 to ITR-7) and even the updated ITR-U form are ready, the filing process can't begin until the government activates the utility software. These utilities are essential tools that help taxpayers fill in, check, and submit their returns online or offline.

ABFRL stock drops 66% post demerger. What investors should know The sharp decline from Wednesday's close of Rs 268.95 reflects the market's adjustment for the value of the demerged entity, not a deterioration in Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail Ltd's fundamentals.

Who is Vaibhav Taneja? Tesla CFO who made more than Pichai and NadellaWhile Sundar Pichai took home $10.73 million and Satya Nadella received $79.1 million in 2024, Taneja's total earnings far exceeded both.

ITC set to report Q4 results today: Earnings, dividend payout in focusSo far this financial year, the diversified FMCG and cigarette giant has already handed out an interim dividend of Rs 6.50 per share. Given its track record, investors are now eyeing another generous payout.

Explained: Why bitcoin has hit a fresh all-time high The world's most valuable cryptocurrency has gained over 50% since April, propelled by improving global risk appetite and a flight to alternatives as doubts over the US dollar's stability grow.

Government notice to Uber over advance tipping, Union Minister calls it 'unethical'The Consumer Protection Body has issued a notice to Uber regarding its practice of collecting advanced tips from users. Union Minister Prahlad Joshi has termed the practice 'deeply concerning', 'unethical and exploitative'. Uber has been given 15 days to respond to the notice. The government is widening its crackdown on practices violating consumer protection norms, with Rapido potentially facing a probe as well.

entertainment.headline: HIT 3 OTT release: When and where to watch Nani's crime thrillerNani's 'HIT: The Third Case' will be streaming in Netflix from May 29, 2025. This earlier-than-expected release has surprised many, as previous reports had suggested a June 5 premiere.

Triptii Dimri to join Prabhas in Sandeep Reddy Vanga's Spirit amid Deepika's exitTriptii Dimri has officially joined Prabhas in Sandeep Reddy Vanga's upcoming film 'Spirit'. This comes amid Deepika Padukone's exit from the project.

Siddhant-Triptii's Dhadak 2 gets U/A certificate after 16 major edits'Dhadak 2', starring Siddhant Chaturvedi and Triptii Dimri, has received a U/A certificate from the CBFC after making 16 major edits to address political, caste, and religious sensitivities. The film is now ready for release after overcoming several certification hurdles.

Crunchyroll Anime Awards 2025: Nominees to live streaming, all you need to knowThe Crunchyroll Anime Awards 2025 returns with a spectacular global live stream featuring top anime series and international stars. Check out everything you need to know.

Sikandar OTT release: When and where to watch Salman-Rashmika's action dramaSalman Khan's action drama 'Sikandar' is set to stream on Netflix from May 25 after a modest box office run. The streaming giant announced the news on social media.

Paresh Rawal returns Hera Pheri 3 signing amount with interest: ReportVeteran actor Paresh Rawal has exited 'Hera Pheri 3' due to disagreements over a payment clause in his contract. He returned the Rs 11 lakh signing amount with 15 per cent interest to the producers.
Great Indian Kapil Show returns with Season 3 and a unique twistKapil Sharma's 'The Great Indian Kapil Show' is set to return with Season 3. The new season will premiere on Netflix on June 21.

Kapkapiii X reviews: Fans call Shreyas-Tusshar's film perfect weekend watchShreyas Talpade and Tusshar Kapoor return with the horror-comedy 'Kapkapiii'. Fans are calling it a fun, must-watch film that brings back the magic of classic Bollywood comedies.

Actor Paritosh Tripathi, wife Meenakshi become parents to baby girlActor Paritosh Tripathi and his wife Meenakshi Chand welcomed their first child, a baby girl, on May 23. Tripathi shared the news with a post on social media.

Vir Das mocks Cannes dress code with fake 'nude, long train' outfitComedian Vir Das hilariously trolled Cannes 2025's strict red carpet dress code by posting a photo-shopped image of himself in an exaggerated nude gown with a long train.

Bollywood expands spectrum as neurodivergent actors become Sitaare Zameen ParBollywood is gradually embracing neurodivergent individuals to share their stories, moving beyond stereotypical portrayals seen before. Films like 'Sitaare Zameen Par' highlight autism and Down syndrome with more authenticity, though challenges remain in true representation.

Rahul Dev mourns brother Mukul's death, cremation to be held in Delhi todayActor Rahul Dev shared a statement after his brother, Mukul Dev's, death. The cremation will take place today, May 24, at 5 pm in Delhi.

Jr NTR to Ajay Devgn, celebs mourn Mukul Dev's deathActor Mukul Dev died at 54 after a brief illness, leaving the Indian film industry in mourning. Friends and colleagues from Bollywood paid heartfelt tributes, remembering him as both a gifted actor and a warm-hearted person.

Anushka Sharma gets worried as ball hits Virat Kohli's helmet at IPL matchAnushka Sharma was in Lucknow on May 23 to support her husband-cricketer Virat Kohli, during the RCB Vs SRH match. The actor looked visibly worried after a ball hit Kohli's helmet.

Mukul Dev, former model and versatile actor known for villain roles, dies at 54Actor Mukul Dev, known for his work in Bollywood films like 'Son of Sardaar', 'Yamla Pagla Deewana' and more, died on Friday, May 23. He was 54.

Bhool Chuk Maaf box office Day 1: Rajkummar Rao's film sees a slow startRajkummar Rao and Wamiqa Gabbi's 'Bhool Chuk Maaf' released in theatres on May 23. The film witnessed a lukewarm opening with Rs 6.75 crore.

Justin Bieber apologises to Hailey for 'mean' dig after she features on Vogue coverSinger Justin Bieber apologised to his wife Hailey Bieber for his 'mean' remarks after she appeared on the latest edition of a magazine cover. The singer has now edited his caption after facing backlash.

Alia Bhatt sparkles in bejewelled dress at Cannes. Don't miss the bold headpieceActor Alia Bhatt sparkled like a diamond in her second appearance at Cannes. The actor wore a bejewelled dress and left fans swooning over her looks.

Muthina Haara: A patriotic tale of Kodava soldier, his family, pride and pain'Muthina Haara' is a 1990 Kannada war drama film directed by three-time National Award winner Rajendra Singh Babu, starring Dr Vishnuvardhan and Suhasini Maniratnam in the lead. From pride and patriotism to mental trauma and the repercussions of war, this film depicts both sides of the coin and remains a timeless classic.

general news.headline: BJP MP's 'women should've fought' remark on Pahalgam attack sparks rowJangra made controversial remarks about the widows of the Pahalgam terror attack, suggesting they should have fought back against the terrorists instead of pleading for their husbands' lives.

Not afraid of ED or PM: Udhayanidhi defends MK Stain attending Niti Aayog meetUdhayanidhi Stalin's comments came in response to Edappadi K Palaniswami's criticism of the Tamil Nadu government boycotting the NITI Aayog meetings over the past three years.

Caught on CCTV: Madhya Pradesh politician engages in obscene act on expresswayThe BJP-backed panchayat leader's husband, Manoharlal Dhakad, has gone missing after CCTV footage of a lewd act on a public expressway sparked outrage and a police FIR.

Yunus govt warns of public-backed action amid pressure from Army chief, BNPThe Muhammad Yunus-led interim government in Bangladesh has warned of public-backed action even as it comes under pressure from the BNP and Army Chief General Waker-Uz-Zaman to hold elections by December. It also spoke of obstacles that were "fuelled by defeated forces" and "foreign conspiracies".

Blast from the Sun 14,000 years ago was so strong trees still remember it It produced solar particles 500 times greater than the most intense solar particle storm recorded by modern satellites in 2005.

Mukul Dev, former model and versatile actor known for villain roles, dies at 54Actor Mukul Dev, known for his work in Bollywood films like 'Son of Sardaar', 'Yamla Pagla Deewana' and more, died on Friday, May 23. He was 54.

Will call spade a spade: In Russia, DMK's Kanimozhi warns Pakistan on terrorKanimozhi, who led the all-party delegation to Russia, echoed Prime Minister Narendra Modi's message that India would make no distinction between terrorists and their sponsors if attacked again.
Tej Pratap Yadav hard launches long-time girlfriend of 12 yearsTej Pratap Yadav publicly revealed his 12-year-long romantic relationship with Anushka Yadav through a Facebook post.

PM Modi's 'one state, one global destination' pitch at Niti Aayog meetNiti Aayog meet: This was the first meeting of Prime Minister Narendra Modi with state chief ministers following Operation Sindoor and India's hostilities with Pakistan.

Dissecting India's Test squad for England: New captain, bold calls and comebacksIndia have named a new-look 18-man Test squad for the England tour, led by Shubman Gill, with several bold selections and notable omissions. The squad marks a generational shift post the retirements of Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma, and R Ashwin, blending youth with experience for the new World Test Championship cycle.

Karnataka temple tax bill, hanging fire for over two months, sent to PresidentThe development comes weeks after the governor returned the Karnataka Hindu Religious Institutions and Charitable Endowments Bill to the Siddaramaiah government.

Harvard's math crisis: Trump's jab, remedial classes and a deeper problemHarvard's 2023 remedial math course is back in the spotlight after Trump mocked students' basic math skills, reigniting debate over admissions, international student policies, and academic standards, exposing wider cracks in the US education system.

Health worker arrested for sharing information on BSF, air force with Pak spyThe accused, a resident of Gujarat, was reportedly in contact with Pakistan's Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI). He has been brought to Ahmedabad for further questioning.

Kerala, Mumbai, Delhi see Covid surge, hospitals told to keep beds, oxygen readyCoronavirus cases: Delhi, Maharashtra, Kerala, Tamil Nadu and Karnataka have all reported fresh cases this month. However, most of the cases are mild.

Aircraft window shades to remain shut at defence airports near Pak borderThe DGCA directive, which comes days after India's western borders saw hostilities with Pakistan, applies to dual-use airports that serve both civilian and military operations.

Bollywood expands spectrum as neurodivergent actors become Sitaare Zameen ParBollywood is gradually embracing neurodivergent individuals to share their stories, moving beyond stereotypical portrayals seen before. Films like 'Sitaare Zameen Par' highlight autism and Down syndrome with more authenticity, though challenges remain in true representation.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Paresh Rawal returns Hera Pheri 3 signing amount with interest: ReportVeteran actor Paresh Rawal has exited 'Hera Pheri 3' due to disagreements over a payment clause in his contract. He returned the Rs 11 lakh signing amount with 15 per cent interest to the producers.

Video: Chai, handshakes, smiles as PM meets chief ministers at Niti Aayog meetPrime Minister Narendra Modi was seen sharing lighter moments with Chief Ministers of various states after he earlier chaired the 10th meeting of the Niti Aayog and drew a roadmap for the development of states on Saturday.

Low vitamin D at birth could predict future mental illnessesA Lancet study finds low vitamin D levels in newborns increase the risk of autism, ADHD, and schizophrenia. This discovery highlights the potential benefits of vitamin D supplementation during pregnancy.

Rahul Gandhi's door-to-door visit in Poonch to interact with Pak shelling victimsRahul Gandhi met victims of recent cross-border shelling in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch district and promised to raise their concerns nationally.

Pak ranks 7th in civilian deaths from blasts, worse than some countries at warIn 2024, Pakistan ranked seventh globally for civilian casualties from explosive weapons, recording 790 casualties. It marked the highest incident count since 2014, according to a report by Action on Armed Violence.

Delhi woman shares inappropriate messages she got from candidate rejected for jobIn a now-viral post on LinkedIn, Ritika Agnihotri, a talent acquisition specialist, shared screenshots of a candidate's inappropriate messages after he failed to secure a job.

sports.headline: Back from wilderness, Kidambi Srikanth shows glimpses of vintage formMalaysia Masters 2025: Former World No. 1 Kidambi Srikanth reached the final of a tournament on the BWF tour for the first time since 2019. Srikanth will take on China's Li Shi Feng in the title match on Sunday, May 25.

England prepare for India Tests with innings victory over ZimbabweEngland secured an innings and 45 runs victory over Zimbabwe in their one-off test at Trent Bridge. The match served as a strong warm-up ahead of India's upcoming five-Test series.

Captain Ben Stokes rethinks England Lions plans ahead of India Test seriesEngland captain Ben Stokes has admitted that he will not be playing the Lions' game against India A after the win against Zimbabwe on Saturday, May 24. Stokes said that he did consider taking part in the game.

ENG vs IND: Sai Sudharsan thrilled to have Shubman Gill as 1st Test captainSai Sudharsan said he was thrilled to work under Shubman Gill once again, this time in India colours. Gill was named as the new captain of the Indian Test team as Sudharsan has also been included in the squad for the England tour.
Best slip catch ever? Harry Brook stunner leaves Ben Stokes spellboundHarry Brook took a spectacular left-handed catch at slip to dismiss Wesley Madhevere. The catch left fans and teammates amazed.

Give captain Shubman Gill a full Test season before judging him: Sunil GavaskarIndia tour of England: Shubman Gill must be given time as Test captain, and the young opener could benefit from the added responsibility, according to legendary cricketer Sunil Gavaskar.

Sarfaraz should take inspiration from Karun Nair for Test return: GavaskarSunil Gavaskar has advised Sarfaraz Khan to take inspiration from Karun Nair in a bid to make it back to the Test team. Speaking to India Today exclusively, Gavaskar said that it was a tough call to drop Sarfaraz from the side but players should cement their spots with the chances they get.

Hope Gill becomes one of India's most successful Test captains: Sunil GavaskarSpeaking to India Today, batting great Sunil Gavaskar welcomed Shubman Gill's selection as India's new Test captain. Gavaskar said Gill will improve his numbers as batter and relish the additional responsibility of captaincy. India, on May 24, announced a jumbo 18-man squad for the upcoming five-Test series in England.

ENG vs IND: Sai Sudharsan ready to be flexible after 1st India Test call-upSai Sudharsan has said he is ready to be flexible for the Indian team after being called up to the squad for the upcoming England tour. Sudharsan was one of the fresh faces in the squad for the game.

Shubman Gill is a natural leader: Eoin Morgan backs new India Test captainEoin Morgan backed Shubman Gill's appointment as India's new Test captain, hailing him as a natural leader. The former England skipper believed Gill was the right choice to lead a young, evolving Indian side.

Sarfaraz should take inspiration from Karun Nair for Test return: GavaskarSunil Gavaskar has advised Sarfaraz Khan to take inspiration from Karun Nair in a bid to make it back to the Test team. Speaking to India Today exclusively, Gavaskar said that it was a tough call to drop Sarfaraz from the side but players should cement their spots with the chances they get.

Hope Gill becomes one of India's most successful Test captains: Sunil GavaskarSpeaking to India Today, batting great Sunil Gavaskar welcomed Shubman Gill's selection as India's new Test captain. Gavaskar said Gill will improve his numbers as batter and relish the additional responsibility of captaincy. India, on May 24, announced a jumbo 18-man squad for the upcoming five-Test series in England.

ENG vs IND: Sai Sudharsan ready to be flexible after 1st India Test call-upSai Sudharsan has said he is ready to be flexible for the Indian team after being called up to the squad for the upcoming England tour. Sudharsan was one of the fresh faces in the squad for the game.

Shubman Gill is a natural leader: Eoin Morgan backs new India Test captainEoin Morgan backed Shubman Gill's appointment as India's new Test captain, hailing him as a natural leader. The former England skipper believed Gill was the right choice to lead a young, evolving Indian side.

Dissecting India's Test squad for England: New captain, bold calls and comebacksIndia have named a new-look 18-man Test squad for the England tour, led by Shubman Gill, with several bold selections and notable omissions. The squad marks a generational shift post the retirements of Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma, and R Ashwin, blending youth with experience for the new World Test Championship cycle.

Mohamed Salah creates history with 2nd Premier League Player Of The Season awardMohamed Salah created history as he won the Premier League Player Of The Year award for the second time. Salah has a chance to complete a special hat-trick with the golden boot and golden playmaker of the year awards as well.

Karun Nair returns to Tests after 7 years: A timeline of his comebackKarun Nair's remarkable return to India's Test squad marks a story of perseverance, resilience, and consistent domestic brilliance — culminating in a well-earned comeback seven years after his last appearance in national whites.

Jasprit Bumrah knows why he is not the India Test captain: AgarkarStar India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah knows why he did not become the new India Test captain, said chief selector Ajit Agarkar. He further added that the board had a chat with Bumrah and that the fast bowler was okay with the explanation given.

Gill new Test captain: Selector Ajit Agarkar explains 18-man England tour squadIndia tour of England: Chief selector Ajit Agarkar addressed the press in Mumbai after announcing India's 18-man squad for the five-Test series, starting June 20. Shubman Gill was named India's new Test captain and Rishabh Pant was appointed his deputy.

Kohli made up his mind about Test retirement in early April: AgarkarAjit Agarkar confirmed Virat Kohli had already communicated his decision to retire from Test cricket in April, as India shifted focus to youth with Shubman Gill leading a new-look side for the England tour.

Kidambi Srikanth enters first final in six years at Malaysia MastersKidambi Srikanth reached his first BWF final in six years, defeating Japan's Yushi Tanaka in straight games at the Malaysia Masters 2024, marking a strong comeback after a prolonged dip in form.

Jasprit Bumrah knows why he is not the India Test captain: AgarkarStar India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah knows why he did not become the new India Test captain, said chief selector Ajit Agarkar. He further added that the board had a chat with Bumrah and that the fast bowler was okay with the explanation given.

Gill new Test captain: Selector Ajit Agarkar explains 18-man England tour squadIndia tour of England: Chief selector Ajit Agarkar addressed the press in Mumbai after announcing India's 18-man squad for the five-Test series, starting June 20. Shubman Gill was named India's new Test captain and Rishabh Pant was appointed his deputy.

Kohli made up his mind about Test retirement in early April: AgarkarAjit Agarkar confirmed Virat Kohli had already communicated his decision to retire from Test cricket in April, as India shifted focus to youth with Shubman Gill leading a new-look side for the England tour.

Kidambi Srikanth enters first final in six years at Malaysia MastersKidambi Srikanth reached his first BWF final in six years, defeating Japan's Yushi Tanaka in straight games at the Malaysia Masters 2024, marking a strong comeback after a prolonged dip in form.

Why Karun Nair, why not Sarfaraz Khan? Selector explains big England tour callIndia tour of England: Karun Nair returned to the Test fold for the first time in eight years. Mumbai batter Sarfaraz Khan was dropped despite India naming an 18-man squad for a five-Test series, starting June 20.

Why Rishabh Pant was made India's Test vice-captain? Chief selector revealsIndia's chief selector Ajit Agarkar revealed what made him pick Rishabh Pant as the vice captain of the Test team as they announced squad for the upcoming England tour.

Jasprit Bumrah won't play all five Tests in England, confirms selector Ajit AgarkarIndia tour of England: Jasprit Bumrah is unlikely to play all five Tests in England, chief selector Ajit Agarkar said after announcing the 18-man squad for the upcoming tour, starting June 20.

Mohammed Shami dropped, Arshdeep Singh earns maiden Test call-up for England tourThe Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) announced the squad for the upcoming five-match Test series against England, set to begin from June 20. Senior fast bowler Mohammed Shami failed to find a spot in the team while Arshdeep Singh earned his maiden Test call up.

Shubman Gill becomes India's 37th Test captain, Rishabh Pant named vice-captainIndia tour of England: Shubman Gill was named as India's 37th Test captain on Saturday. Rishabh Pant was appointed as the vice-captain of the Test team as India begin a new cycle of World Test Championship.

Shami working hard for England tour, wants to lead pace attack with BumrahStar India fast bowler Mohammed Shami has revealed that he's working extremely hard to be fit for the England tour and is looking to lead the pace attack alongside Jasprit Bumrah.

Pat Cummins, Rajat Patidar fined for slow-over rate in RCB vs SRH clashRCB captain Rajat Patidar and SRH skipper Pat Cummins fined for slow over-rate during IPL 2025 clash; other players also penalized with fines based on match fees following the May 23 clash in Lucknow.

Punjab Kings eyeing top spot against battered Delhi CapitalsPunjab Kings (PBKS) and Delhi Capitals (DC) are all set to lock horns in Match 66 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) in Jaipur. Delhi have been knocked out of the tournament following their loss against Mumbai Indians (MI), while Punjab are eyeing a top two finish.

Shubman Gill as Test captain will be a bold move: Saba Karim backs batterFormer India cricketer Saba Karim backed Shubman Gill to become India's next Test captain, calling it a bold but progressive step as the BCCI prepares for a new leadership era ahead of the England tour.

We'll always be aggressive and positive: SRH assistant coach after win vs RCBSunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) assistant coach Simon Helmot said that their team will always look to be positive and aggressive following a 42-run win against Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB). SRH registered their fifth win of the season as Ishan Kishan starred with an unbeaten 94* (48).

Not worried about table position, we're just looking at next game: RCB's Phil SaltRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) opening batter Philip Salt said that the team is only looking forward to the next game and isn't thinking too much about where they'd finish on the points table.

SRH Assistant coach delighted with Ishan Kishan's 'mature' innings vs RCBSunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) assistant coach Simon Helmot was full of praise for Ishan Kishan following his match-winning innings of 94* (48) vs Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB).

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
